Bantah Debt Collector, Ini Tugas Kader JKN!
02 Nov 2019, 20:55 by Sugandi Afandi


Bantah Debt Collector, Ini Tugas Kader JKN!

KBRN, Jakarta: Badan Penyelenggara Jaminan Sosial (BPJS) Kesehatan  selaku pelaksana Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional (JKN)  terus berupaya untuk meningkatkan kesadaran masyarakat  agar patuh membayar iuran termasuk dengan mendatangi kediaman warga yang menunggak.
Kepala Humas BPJS Kesehatan M Iqbal Anas ma’ruf membantah pemberitaan media yang menyebut institusinya melibatkan debt collector. Sesungguhnya yang diterjunkan adalah kader JKN.
“Kami ingin menyampaikan soal debt collector. Itu tidak benar. Itu judul berita supaya menarik saja. Fungsi jauh dengan debt collector,” tegas M Iqbal Anas ma’ruf kepada wartawan, Sabtu (2/11/2019).
M Iqbal menjelaskan jumlah kader JKN mencapai 3.264 orang. Mereka direkrut dengan sistem kemitraan seperti ojek online. Adapun tugas mereka adalah menagih penunggak iuran mandiri diatas 4 bulan. Dia menegaskan, dalam menjalankan tugasnya, Kader JKN mengedepankan pendekatan secara persuasif.
“Kader berfungsi mengingatkan, bisa juga menerima pendaftaran melalui beliau. Kalau ada keluhan-keluhan juga monggo disampaikan kepada kader. Didatangi ke rumah dengan sopan dan tentu dengan cara baik untuk menyampaikan tanggung jawab. Membantu menjadi jembatan antara masyarakat dengan BPJS Kesehatan kalau ada keluhan menjadi bagian yang harus direspon,” terangnya.
M Iqbal menegaskan penagihan merupakan salah satu kewenangan dari BPJS Kesehatan. Mengenai sanksi bagi penunggak, masih digodok.
“PP Nomor 86 tahun 2013, tidak termasuk SKCK. IMB, KTP, SIM,  paspor dan ekskusi belum. Konteksnya masyarakat mau membuat SIM maka ditanyain dulu apakah ada BPJS Kesehatan. Kalau tidak ada maka diarahkan . Kita belajar dari negara lain menertibkan . Ada semacam efek jera,” ujarnya. (Sgd)

Debt Collector Denies, It's the JKN Cadre's Job!
02 Nov 2019, 20:55 by Sugandi Afandi


Debt Collector Denies, It's the JKN Cadre's Job!

KBRN, Jakarta: The Social Security Administering Agency (BPJS) as the implementer of the National Health Insurance (JKN) continues to strive to increase public awareness of complying with contributions including by visiting the residences of citizens who are in arrears.
Head of Public Relations BPJS Health M Iqbal Anas Ma'ruf denied media reports that said his institution involved a debt collector. In fact what was deployed was JKN cadres.
"We want to convey the problem of debt collectors. That is not true. That's the headline so it's interesting. The function is far from the debt collector, "said M Iqbal Anas Ma'ruf to reporters on Saturday (11/2/2019).
M Iqbal explained that the number of JKN cadres reached 3,264 people. They are recruited with a partnership system such as an online motorcycle taxi. Their job is to collect arrears of independent contributions over 4 months. He asserted, in carrying out their duties, JKN cadres prioritized a persuasive approach.
"The cadre functions as a reminder, can also receive registration through him. If there are complaints, please also submit it to the cadre. Be visited at home politely and certainly in a good way to convey responsibility. Helping to become a bridge between the community and BPJS Health if there are complaints is a part that must be responded to, "he explained.
M Iqbal emphasized that billing is one of the authorities of BPJS Health. Regarding sanctions for delinquents, are still being drafted.
"PP No. 86 of 2013, not including SKCK. IMB, KTP, SIM, passport and execution have not yet. The context is that the community wants to make a SIM, so first ask whether there is a BPJS Health. If there isn't, then it is directed. We learn from other countries bring order. There is a kind of deterrent effect, "he said. (SGD)
